unit_learning_outcomes.description: Develop intermediate level skills in reading, writing, listening and speaking in the Japanese language.
Demonstrate a refined awareness of language and language use, in both Japanese and in English.
Apply relevant language conventions to create meaningful intercultural encounters.
Identify, evaluate and deploy the grammatical structures of Japanese at intermediate level.
Identify, describe and evaluate many aspects of Japanese-speaking cultures and societies.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Students are expected to spend time on daily review of grammar and vocabulary, and Japanese practice. Students should feel comfortable with each week’s content before starting a new week.

enrolment_rules.description: HSC Japanese Continuers or HSC Japanese Extension

assessments.description: Students are to complete the weekly quizzes. Self Tests are provided as examples.
The in-class online test is a comprehensive test of listening, reading and writing skills, covering all unit content.
Weekly activities to check and confirm active engagement with course material.
Students are required to discuss a given topic in Japanese in a group, using the contents and skills they have learned in the unit.
The written test includes first half of session content.

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 1, Fully online/virtual
Session 1, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 1, Special circumstances

academic_org.value: Department of Media, Communications, Creative Arts, Language and Literature

data.description: This unit is designed to develop skills in all areas of Japanese language (reading, writing, listening and speaking) to a higher level of proficiency. Students learn to discuss a wider range of topics as well as substantially increase their knowledge of vocabulary and kanji. This unit also focuses on further increasing students' skills in intercultural communication so that they will be able to communicate in a manner which is culturally as well as linguistically appropriate. Interactive tutorials and the use of online resources provide students with opportunities to use Japanese as much as possible.
data.title: C Japanese Studies 3
